channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: CES 2026 had a surprising phone presence — here are 5 of my top picks
item.description: Looks like smartphones are back on the menu at CES 2026: from the Galaxy TriFold to a BlackBerry-style throwback.

item.title: Just days after Ikea launched its cute cube speakers, this bookshelf option fits your flatpack furniture even better
item.description: The Eversolo SE100 is designed with Ikea furniture in mind, but with more sonic prowess than Ikea’s own speakers.

item.title: Betterment’s financial app sends customers a $10,000 crypto scam message
item.description: Betterment, a financial app, sent a sketchy-looking notification on Friday asking users to send $10,000 to Bitcoin and Ethereum crypto wallets and promising to "triple your crypto," according to a thread on Reddit. The Betterment account says in an X thread that this was an "unauthorized message" that was sent via a "third-party system." Here's […]

item.title: OpenAI Is Asking Contractors to Upload Work From Past Jobs to Evaluate the Performance of AI Agents
item.description: To prepare AI agents for office work, the company is asking contractors to upload projects from past jobs, leaving it to them to strip out confidential and personally identifiable information.

item.title: I met a lot of weird robots at CES — here are the most memorable
item.description: If the robots don't always give a totally accurate representation of where commercial deployment is at the moment, they do give visitors a peek at where their parent companies might be headed.

item.title: ‘We’re redefining eyewear on a really high level. I like to use a camera analogy: fixed focus, manual focus, and then autofocus. What we’re trying to do is autofocus’ – IXI's CEO on the tech behind CES 2026’s most exciting eyeglasses
item.description: IXI's eyeglasses automatically change their focus depending on what you're looking at it. Here's how it works.

item.title: Google moonshot spinout SandboxAQ claims an ex-exec is attempting ‘extortion’
item.description: A former SandboxAQ executive filed a wrongful termination lawsuit filled with shocking allegations. The company is fighting back, hard.

item.title: 'I don’t think we can call ourselves a toy anymore because we’re an iconic experience company' — Lego on how Smart Bricks expand the system and how 'this just adds a new dimension'
item.description: After eight years in development, Lego’s Smart Play system brings custom silicon, sensing, and responsiveness to a familiar form: the Smart Brick. To unpack what that means for the future of physical play, TechRadar spoke with Julia Goldin, Lego’s Chief Product & Marketing Officer, and Tom Donaldson, Head of the Creative Play Lab, at CES 2026.

item.title: Grok Is Being Used to Mock and Strip Women in Hijabs and Saris
item.description: A substantial number of AI images generated or edited with Grok are targeting women in religious and cultural clothing.

item.title: Engadget's best of CES 2026: All the new tech that caught our eye in Las Vegas
item.description: Over 4,000 exhibitors flocked to Las Vegas, Nevada this week to showcase their wares at CES 2026. The Engadget team, as usual, was out in full force covering the show. The week began with press conferences from huge companies at the show, mostly filled with AI buzzwords, vague promises and quite little in the way of hard news.More than one company even decided to forgo announcing things during their conferences to make way for more AI chatter, only to publish press releases later quietly admitting that, yes, actually, they did make some consumer technology. It's appropriate, I guess, that as ...
